intro: Gagnepainia, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plants typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce showy, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or orange. Many species within this genus are adapted to arid environments, showcasing succulent stems and leaves. They are also notable for their toxic alkaloids, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
